akas: Angelo e cel mai tare Romania
akas from release info: Angelo e cel mai tare Romania

-1.title: Best Friend Forever
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Detention
1.plot: When Angelo's parents want to sell all of his favorite old toys at a rummage sale, Angelo schemes how to save his stuff from being sold.

2.title: Cat Box
2.plot: Angelo's chore is to clean Joe Mama's litter box all week, but of course he wants to find a way to get out of it. He comes up with several schemes in order to turn Joe Mama into a clean independent cat.

3.title: Yakking It Up
3.plot: Angelo and Sherwood come up with several strategies to stay super late and watch the Yak Wrestling Championships live on TV.

4.title: The Greatest Free Sample Ever
4.plot: In an elaborate heist-like plan Angelo and friends work to get their hands on one of the legendary free cupcake samples Cathy gives out at her Snack Shack.

5.title: Go Mental Fest
5.plot: When tickets to their favorite rock band Slobber is sold out, Angelo creates an alternative (fake) event to siphon away all the fans. He creates such a hype that Slobber ends up playing Angelo's event.

6.title: Clean Break
6.plot: Angelo and Sherwood broke Mom's favorite statue (an authentic Damian Burst) as they were playing ball in the living room. They need to cover their tracks by making the parents believe Peter is the culprit.

7.title: Battle Underwear
7.plot: Angelo and Sherwood are excited to be at the unveiling of a new cool product for boys - Battle Underwear. But there's only one way to attend (the horror!), Angelo must pretend he really wants to go clothes shopping with mom.

8.title: Pop Quiz
8.plot: To take the surprise out of Mr. Foot's pop quizzes, Angelo and friends try to figure out when the quizzes will be held so they can study ahead of time.

9.title: Picked Last
9.plot: To score themselves special passes to Adventureparkland, Angelo and friends help the uncoordinated Butterfingers (son of Adventureparkland's owner) get picked first for volleyball teams in gym class.

10.title: Lords of the Prize
10.plot: Hoping to win Angelo's mom a relaxing trip to Hawaii, Angelo and friends secretly listen to the radio in school awaiting the DJ to say "Aloha"-the cue to call the station.

11.title: Bolivia Exports Farts
11.plot: After Peter accidentally emails a class paper about Bolivia riddled with the word "fart" to Mr. Foot, Angelo and friends have to figure out way to get on Mr. Foot's computer and fix the problem paper before he finds out.

12.title: A Fish Called Mr. Bubble
12.plot: After Sherwood swallows Peter's goldfish, Angelo and Sherwood set out to find a replacement goldfish before Peter finds out his pet is missing.

13.title: Snack Thief
13.plot: Who's stealing all the snacks at school. It has to be Manetti, but can Angelo prove it?

14.title: Spitball Wars
14.plot: Angelo and friends concoct an elaborate defense against Manetti's spitballs, which isn't easy because they must do it all behind Mr. Foot's back during class.

15.title: Let Manetti Win
15.plot: Worried Lola might get hurt by Manetti if she beats him in a video game challenge, Angelo and Sherwood secretly help Manetti win.

16.title: A Longer Recess
16.plot: Angelo forgot to write his History assignment, and he has to give it in the next period. He' doesn't even have time to copy Sherwood's paper - Unless he extends the recess.

17.title: Chore Wars
17.plot: When Angelo is given the really crappy household chores to do and his sister Elena gets the super easy ones, he conspires to get his sister to do his chores.

18.title: Changing the Channel
18.plot: To watch their own show on TV, Angelo and friends scheme to get Dad to watch his big championship basketball game somewhere else.

19.title: Riding the Dragontail
19.plot: When Sherwood is too short to ride the zip line at Adventureparkland, Angelo concocts several plans to bypass Hunter (the attendant) and make sure his best buddy gets a ride.

20.title: The Great Wait
20.plot: A famous skateboarder is signing autographs at Adventureparkland and Angelo and friends are counting on seeing him. But the line is too long, so they scheme on ways to either get in front of the line, or bypass it altogether.

21.title: Adorable Horrible Peter
21.plot: Because Peter is so damn cute, he can get whatever he wants from mom and dad, which bothers Angelo. So Angelo needs to bring him down a couple notches and make his brother seem less cute.

22.title: Who Killed the Rabbit?
22.plot: In a classic Whodunit, Angelo plays the role of Sherlock Holmes and takes us step by step through his demented process of figuring out what happened to Peter's favorite stuffed rabbit.

23.title: Stop the Experimental Music
23.plot: Mom has a new hobby: listening to experimental music. There has to be a way for Angelo to stop this audio assault.

24.title: No Substitute
24.plot: In an elaborate scheme, Angelo attempts to arrange a free period by tricking Coach Zonka, their substitute teacher.

25.title: The Casserole
25.plot: Angelo hates that every Tuesday he has to eat his mom's brussels sprout casserole. Fighting this injustice, Angelo schemes to change the recipe.

26.title: Out of the Saddle
26.plot: Angelo wants to take karate classes, but Mom is dead set on horse riding lessons - which is so girly. Angelo will just have to convince Mom that horse riding is the most dangerous thing in the world.

27.title: Angelo's Blunder
27.plot: Angelo just sold Mom's precious Damian Burst painting at a yard sale. He needs to find a way to get it back from Cathy before Mom realizes it's gone.

28.title: The Sneeze
28.plot: Angelo tries to help Lola get her horrible school photo retaken before anyone ever sees it.

29.title: Shame of Lame
29.plot: Angelo really wants Elena's very cool new J-Pod. So he does everything imaginable to make the "cool" totally "uncool" so she'll give it up.

30.title: Here Comes the Judge
30.plot: Angelo pretends to be a famous skateboarder so he can judge a skateboarding contest Sherwood has entered in, and try to insure that the boys will take home the prize - a skate ramp.

31.title: Break Up
31.plot: Every time Elena has her heart broken, she turns into the meanest sister in the world. So when Angelo sees that Hunter is about to dump her, he knows he has to stop him .

32.title: Tha Fake Sick Day
32.plot: Angelo fakes sick one day and stays home from school. Success. But Angelo has to sneak back to school to give Sherwood his paper without being seen.

33.title: The Kid Who Has Everything
33.plot: Angelo wants a really awesome video game chair for his birthday, but mom already bought a bunch of boring educational gifts for him. So Angelo plans to find the gifts mom bought and play with them in front of her so she thinks he already has them.

34.title: Zonka's Death March
34.plot: Angelo and friends come up with an elaborate scheme to avoid Coach Zonka's notorious 2K run.

35.title: The Beach
35.plot: Not wanting to miss Lola's cool older cousin Cindy (who he has a crush on), Angelo's tries to get out of going to the beach for the weekend.

36.title: Collect Them All
36.plot: Angelo and Sherwood scheme to find a way to get the last of the new action figures (from the toy store) to complete their collection.

37.title: Manetti's Crush
37.plot: Manetti gets a crush on Elena which drives her crazy. So Angelo and friends give her a hand in several attempts at warding Manetti off.

38.title: Manetti Must Not Fail
38.plot: Sherwood is assigned tutor, which is torture. But since Manetti is pretty stupid, they have to resort to cheating.

39.title: Help! My Friends Are Falling in Love!
39.plot: Lola and Sherwood have a big fight. Angelo worries, because on television, this kind of hostility between members of the opposite sex invariably leads to romance. He has no intention of being a third wheel, and ultimately dropped by his friends so he schemes to really break them apart to bring them together.

40.title: The Brush Off
40.plot: Mom invites needy artist Damien Burst to stay with them for a while. Damien proves to be the worst house guest ever so...Angelo and his siblings work together to get him out.

41.title: A Little Romance
41.plot: There's no way Butterfingers will ever be able to ask Monica to the school dance - Unless Angelo and his friends turn him into Prince Charming.

42.title: Mission: Frog
42.plot: Mr Foot is going to dissect a frog in biology class. Angelo and friends stage an escape plan for the helpless green cutie.

43.title: USB Mine
43.plot: The biggest rock band in the whole world, Slobber, have hidden an exclusive USB stick in a box of cereals. Angelo and his friends will try everything to be the ones to find it.

44.title: School Heist
44.plot: Angelo and friends plan a big heist of the teachers lounge "confiscated item stash" to recover Butterfinger's prized comic book that was confiscated by Foot. The kids find a lot more than they bargained for.

45.title: Working Hard
45.plot: Angelo helps his sister get a job at Adventureparkland so she can save up enough money to buy a moped (and drive him around).

46.title: Scary Movie
46.plot: Angelo and Sherwood absolutely want to watch the horror movie that's showing on TV tonight, but Angelo's parents have forbidden it. But Angelo's got a plan.

47.title: Final Countdown
47.plot: At last, Angelo is about to get to the last level of his video game. But he's also promised to clean his room and do his homework - He's going to have to improvise.

48.title: Thar He Blows!
48.plot: Peter's got a new toy - a trumpet. How is Angelo going to stop his infernal racket when his mother is trying to foster Peter's creativity?

49.title: Yesterbirthday
49.plot: The worst day of the year is coming: Manetti's birthday. It's going to be all roundhouse kicks and mustard pies - unless Angelo manages to convince Manetti his birthday has already happened.

50.title: Career Day
50.plot: Angelo's father is to come and talk about his work before Angelo's classmates. And it's going to be monumentally boring - unless they can stop from talking.

51.title: The Break In
51.plot: Elena's hidden a mysterious package in her room. Angelo and his friends have no choice: they have to pull off the robbery of the century.

52.title: Director's Cut
52.plot: When Mr. Foot refuses to show Angelo and his friends' home-made Viking film in history class, the three are set on changing Mr. Foot's mind.

53.title: One Shot
53.plot: Butterfingers despairs because he can never make a basketball shot. But that's all gonna change now that he has Angelo in his corner.

54.title: The Chimp Sleeps Tonight
54.plot: Tonight Angelo and Sherwood must get Peter to go to bed if they're to play their new game. But how do you get an overexcited monkey to sleep?

55.title: Savant Idiot
55.plot: Sherwood is so good in class that Mr Foot has decided to send him to a school for the gifted, far away from Angelo and Lola. They're going to have to convince the teacher that Sherwood is actually a dunce.

56.title: Face the Music
56.plot: Angelo has completely forgotten about the presentation on a musician who changed history. He's going to have to improvise and get the whole class to dance along.

57.title: The Thousandth
57.plot: How do you make sure you'll be the thousandth customer at the mall and win a great prize? Ask Angelo.

58.title: Fearless
58.plot: Manetti loves scaring everybody so much no one can take it any more. There's only one solution: scare him too. But it seems he isn't afraid of anything.

59.title: Dirty Politics
59.plot: Sherwood doesn't want to run for class captain, when he'd be perfect for the role - So Angelo and Lola - will run instead of him.

60.title: Friend vs. Friend
60.plot: Angelo and friends win a new futuristic skateboard. But that's when the problems begin, because they can't figure out how to share it.

61.title: The Audition Mission
61.plot: Miss Perla's decided to put up a show about Slobber's music. Angelo, Lola and Sherwood absolutely want to be part of it. The only hitch: Sherwood can't sing or dance.

62.title: Tea Time
62.plot: If the old neighbor isn't here by 3pm, Angelo will have the house to himself. But how is he going to stop her when she's only got one street to cross?

63.title: Wanna Piece of Me?
63.plot: Manetti's little brother Cooper picks a fight with Angelo. Of course Angelo can't fight a little kid. But he has to figure out how to get out of the fight and change his new reputation as a wimp.

64.title: The List
64.plot: The girls have mistakenly slipped the list of the cutest boys in the class into Manetti's bag. And he's the last one on the list. If Angelo doesn't get the list back, things are going to get ugly.

65.title: Shower Up
65.plot: Every morning, Elena spends so much time in the bathroom that Angelo can't wash before he has to go to school. Today, though, he's got a plan.

66.title: The Fever
66.plot: Angelo's got a huge cold, and if his parents notice, they won't let him go and see Ollie Van Dunk's show.

67.title: In the bag
67.plot: Angelo's Mom's dream handbag has just been delivered to the mall. With a present like that, Mom will forgive Angelo for anything - unless she buys it first.

68.title: King of the Sidewalk
68.plot: Manetti has staked out a piece of sidewalk that he calls his own, and no kid is allowed to walk on it. But that sidewalk is the quickest way for Angelo to get home. Angelo vows to break Manetti's roadblock.

69.title: Money Money Money
69.plot: Today, Cathy starts selling her delicious, limited-edition pies, and Angelo and his friends have no money at all. They're going to have to convince her to give them away.

70.title: Cereal Zombie
70.plot: Peter is a sleepwalker, and every night he gulps down bowls of Angelo's favorite cereals. Operation: breakfast rescue.

71.title: Picture Perfect
71.plot: Elena has laid her hands on one of Angelo's tests, and threatens to show it to the parents. There's only one solution: finding a really embarrassing picture of Elena to trade with. Or even creating one.

72.title: Career Test
72.plot: The orientation test results are clear: Sherwood was made to become - a teacher, like Mr Foot. The horror. But Angelo decrees that Sherwood will be a secret agent, and he'll start right now.

73.title: Sherwood's Fault
73.plot: The whole class was given a pop quiz because of Sherwood. Angel and Lola will do everything to make him popular again.

74.title: Curse
74.plot: Angelo's uttered a huge curse word in front of Peter and, of course, he's going to run to repeat it to the parents. How to stop him?

75.title: Cool kid
75.plot: Arthur, Butterfingers' big brother, won't stop mocking him - and everyone else. It's high time he was shown he isn't the champ at Park Adventure.

76.title: The Book Club
76.plot: Once again, Angelo's mom and her friends are going to use the living room all day to talk about boring books. Unless Angelo can convince them they'd be much better off somewhere else.

77.title: Manettied
77.plot: Guess who Angelo's Mom has invited to spend the day? Manetti. Angelo has to come up with a good excuse to avoid that, and quickly.

78.title: Ticking Clock
78.plot: There's no way one can organize a party for a mom in under half an hour - unless one is called Angelo.

1.title: Junkboy
1.plot: When Angelo's parents want to sell all of his favorite old toys at a rummage sale, Angelo schemes how to save his stuff from being sold.

2.title: Kick-it Ball
2.plot: Angelo and friends' attempt to play their weekly Kick It Ball game is disrupted by Shmitty who also claims the basketball court.

3.title: Game Off
3.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

4.title: The Sandman Cometh
4.plot: Angelo meets his match for the first time when Tracy Flickinger arrives at school and they face off in an epic high noon hallway showdown.

5.title: Bullicus Smarticus
5.plot: Angelo meets his match for the first time when Tracy Flickinger arrives at school and they face off in an epic high noon hallway showdown.

6.title: The Cool Hat
6.plot: When Alonzo wears a new hat to school he instantly becomes super popular and is offered special favors usually given to Angelo. So Angelo changes his look and tries to figure out what is the coolest hat ever.

7.title: Spoiler Alert
7.plot: Angelo couldn't watch the Yak Wrestling finals on TV last night. Everyone at school has seen it but him, and it's all everybody's talking about - even Sherwood. Angelo is going to have to come up with tons of tricks in order to view the game without someone spoiling the score for him.

8.title: How to Dismantle an Alert Attack
8.plot: Angelo sets out to pull off the greatest alien attack prank ever, but when his mom fills in for Mr. Foot he has to dismantle it instead.

9.title: Operation Water Park
9.plot: Angelo goes all out in an attempt to get his family out of bed and on the road before 5 a.m. to get to an awesome water park before it opens.

10.title: Doy to the World
10.plot: Peter and Cooper use the word "doy" non-stop which drives Angelo batty. So Angelo comes up with every strategy he can think of to try to get the little guys to stop.

11.title: Book War
11.plot: Peter and Cooper sell handmade books by the dozen, which inspires Angelo to do the same. But the little guys have much better results, which fuels Angelo to beat them.

12.title: Ninja for Hire
12.plot: Angelo needs to make some extra money so he takes on a part time job - as a ninja.

13.title: Wiznimals
13.plot: Angelo thought he could relax this weekend but then he's assigned a real chore: taking his baby brother Peter to the Wiznimal convention - those super-annoying toy animals that kids are crazy about. Card games, video games, cartoons, stuffed toys, they're everywhere - and they really are annoying. How can Angelo get Peter to outgrow them - and get his Saturday back?

14.title: Buddy Page
14.plot: Angelo's family keep embarrassing him in front of his friends on Buddypage, the latest popular social network. But how do you get your mom, dad, sister and brother to unfriend you without starting a family feud?

15.title: Ping Pong
15.plot: Angelo and friends train Geezer to become the Community Center's ping pong champ in exchange for Geezer pretending to be Angelo's "fake Grandpa" and attend his sure to be bad news parent-teacher conference with Mr. Foot.

16.title: Bring It Back
16.plot: On Tracy's suggestion, Coach Zonka has decided to replace basketball with - rhythmic gymnastics. No way. There's got to be a way of convincing the whole class that basketball is the best sport there is.

17.title: Family Game Night
17.plot: Dad and Angelo develop a fierce rivalry to win at the weekly Family Game Night, with Angelo always losing. So Angelo schemes on ways to beat his dad.

18.title: Courtroom TV
18.plot: Angelo wants to set up the old TV in his room, now that his parents have bought a new one. But his big sister wants it too. How can he prevail? Easy. He just needs to set up a mock court room and plea like they do in his parents' TV shows.

19.title: Damage Remote Control
19.plot: Angelo's dad has bought a super-hi-tech remote-control that controls everything in the house - and Angelo's just broken it. How can he replace it without his Dad finding out? Easy: fake all of the remote's functions with Sherwood's help - while Lola works the guarantee.

20.title: Fame
20.plot: Angelo sets out to make Sherwood famous, but a viral video makes him famous for the wrong reasons when he introduces the expression "achibada" to the world's vocabulary.

21.title: The Funniest Kid
21.plot: Angelo thinks he's a lock to be voted "Funniest Kid In School" again, but his title is unexpectedly challenged - by Lola.

22.title: Silent Treatment
22.plot: Tracy challenges Angelo: she bets him she can hold back on tattle-tailing longer than he can go without talking. Angelo is up for it. But Tracy will go to any lengths to win this thing, she even barges in at his place uninvited. How can Angelo make her slip without unsealing his lips?

23.title: Catch That Cat
23.plot: Cathy has entrusted her cat to the care of Angelo and Lola for the day - in return, they can binge on pies all they will. Great deal, right? Unless the cat escapes the second it touches the ground. How do you persuade a reluctant cat to get back into its cage?

24.title: Soccer Tryouts
24.plot: Sherwood is devastated: he was late for tryouts and won't be on the soccer team this year. Unless - Who said you could only demonstrate your soccer skills on a soccer field? Certainly not Angelo.

25.title: No Take Backs
25.plot: While he was distracted by his video game, Angelo accidentally gave Peter his Slobber concert VIP access bracelet. And his mom won't budge: once you're given something, you can't take it back. Angelo only has a few hours to convince Peter to give up the bracelet - which he seems most unwilling to let go of.

26.title: Fieldtrip of Dreams
26.plot: This year, Mr Foot has organized a field trip to - an experimental play by Damien Brousse. Since tattle-tale Tracy absolutely wants to see the play, Angelo is going to have to plot in the shadows to spare the whole class endless boredom.

27.title: Door to Door to Door
27.plot: Angelo and friends face off against Tracy in a battle to see who can sell the most wrapping paper for a school fundraiser.

28.title: Heatwave
28.plot: Angelo and friends want to be the first to master a difficult new skateboarding move, but to do so they have to find a way to beat a massive heatwave that makes it impossible to practice outside.

29.title: Clean Up
29.plot: Angelo attempts to discreetly clean up a moldy ant covered sandwich he had hidden in his room - without getting busted.

30.title: When Peter Attacks!
30.plot: Angelo persuades Mr. Foot to let him use the IT room over the weekend: officially, he'll be researching biology - unofficially? He'll be playing video games online. But come the weekend, it turns out he must babysit Peter. Angelo decides to bring him along and entrust him to Schmitty's care while he plays his games. Except Peter escapes Schmitty's watch.

31.title: Cabin Fever
31.plot: Angelo has been waiting for the weekend to get his parents to sign a test that he failed, to make sure they're as relaxed as can be. Tough luck: a storm breaks out, crushing everyone's plans. Tensions rise, and it looks like Angelo has picked the worst time to break the news about his test. He must find a way to ease the tension - fast.

32.title: Frontier Family
32.plot: When Mr. Foot assigns a long book for the class to read, Angelo sets out to prove that he will know all he needs to know about the book without reading a single word of it.

33.title: Karate Kids
33.plot: Manetti got his brown belt in Zonkarate, Coach Zonka's very own karate, for months already - but he just keep going on about it. Angelo and Sherwood can't wait to get their own brown belts - but, in order to do so, they must hack a wooden board in two with one hand - that's impossible. Unless they turn into Manetti, that is.

34.title: Ice Cream Panic
34.plot: Angelo's enjoying a cone of his favorite ice-cream at Adventure Park. But Dad criticizes the recipe, and the saleswoman hires him to rethink their whole range of flavors. She hands him a suitcase full of refrigerated samples along with a form to fill out. Angelo has got to get the suitcase away from Dad before he decides to remove the "Angelo Special" from the menu.

35.title: Mini grand prix
35.plot: Angelo and Sherwood have stranded their remote-controlled car in Geezer's garden. Their neighbor has no intention of returning the toy, although he already owns one of his own. In order to get it back, Angelo and Sherwood challenge Geezer to a race between their two cars. But Geezer's is much more powerful than theirs.

36.title: The Case of Missing Controlers
36.plot: When Dad misplaces Angelo's prized video game controllers and then goes on a trip, Angelo rallies his friends, mom and Peter to find the controllers at all costs.

37.title: Stealth plan
37.plot: Angelo has snatched back all the desserts Tracy had unfairly confiscated at the school cafeteria. But he's left incriminating evidence: a shoe print in a lasagna dish. Now he must make fake lasagna before his shoe-print lands him in detention. Better yet: fabricate a new shoe print pointing to a new culprit - like Tracy, for instance.

38.title: Break a Leg
38.plot: Eww. Angelo has been cast as Tracy's enamoured suitor for the school play - which he has to act in front of the whole class. gross. The only one who'll take his part is Manetti. But that means Angelo must turn Manetti into a brilliant actor before the show, and the big bully can't memorize over a word at a time.

39.title: Buddy Guard
39.plot: Angelo's family keep embarrassing him in front of his friends on Buddypage, the latest popular social network. But how do you get your mom, dad, sister and brother to unfriend you without starting a family feud?

40.title: Brain Scrambler
40.plot: Angelo and friends celebrate the end of school at Adventureparkland and ride the brand new Brainscrambler roller coaster dozens of times which causes them to lose their memory of party. The three spend the rest of the day trying to desperately figure out why Sherwood has a beard, who Lola kissed, and where Angelo's dad's video camera had gone.

41.title: Foot by Foot
41.plot: Angelo finds a box full of Elena's old tests and realizes Mr Foot has been giving the same ones for years. Which means Elena holds all the answers. What a windfall. Elena agrees to share her precious papers with Angelo so he won't have to study for tests again - on one condition: he must do her all sorts of favors.

42.title: Revolution
42.plot: Mr. Foot has put Tracy in charge of the school surveillance. The thing is, Tracy is Mr. Foot's niece, and she goes on a power trip, punishing kids under all kinds of ludicrous pretenses, making up new rules as she goes along. Angelo has had enough of her behavior: this calls for a revolution.

43.title: Air Guitar Hero
43.plot: Slobber is holding an air guitar battle whose winner will feature in their next video clip. Angelo is determined to win. But Ethan, the online air-guitar champion, is competing, too, dashing every other contestant's hopes of winning. Angelo teams up with Lola and Sherwood and work on a killer routine. Then Lola gets stage fright.

44.title: Girl Pyjama Party
44.plot: Lola's girl's night in is totally ruined by Tracy, who crashes the party and claims she can talk to spirits. This calls for one of Angelo's rescue strategies. But Tracy's being extra suspicious - the only way to kick her out is to make her believe the spirits do talk to her - and they're telling her to get out.

45.title: Battle for the Room
45.plot: Angelo, Sherwood and Lola have started an awesome rock band for the school party. To make sure they're ready, they decide to rehearse in the community center. But Geezer's hogging it with his stupid boards game society - it's only got one member: him. Angelo and his friends will do whatever it takes to kick him out and finally get a chance to rehearse.

46.title: Bed Race
46.plot: Everyone is taking part in the town's big bed race. And, this year, Angelo is bent upon winning - Tracy cheated her way to the trophy last year and there's no way that's happening again. Angelo's got an aerodynamic bed, a super-trained bed-pusher, he's got intel on his competition and a secret ally on the course - This year, anything goes.

47.title: The Candy Vault
47.plot: When Angelo finds out about a giant candy vault located under the school that holds every piece of candy that has ever been confiscated, he and the gang set out to pull off the greatest candy heist of all time and take back what's theirs.

48.title: Cosmic Pirates
48.plot: Manetti lends his favorite movie, Cosmic Pirates 17, to Angelo and his buddies. The movie is totally lame. But things go awry when Angelo accidentally damages the precious DVD: the last five minutes are all scratched. Since they can't get another copy, Angelo and his friends decide to re-shoot the end of the movie.

49.title: The Ultimate Locker
49.plot: Angelo secretly transforms his locker into the coolest hangout in school, until jealous Tracy tries to shut it down.

1.title: Mind Reader
1.plot: Angelo shares his tips and tricks on how to expertly procrastinate instead of studying for a test. The centerpiece of his plan-- waste his time building a mind reading helmet!

2.title: Tracy-sitting
2.plot: Mom hires Tracy to babysit Peter. Yikes! Angelo must protect his home at all costs.

3.title: Night at the Department Store
3.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

4.title: Angelo Time
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Space Cadet
5.plot: Angelo and Lola help Sherwood get into Space Camp by making an elaborate video of Sherwood as an astronaut with the Right Stuff.

6.title: The Cheating Kind
6.plot: Angelo tries a variety of strategies in an effort to cure Tracy of her obsession with cheating on anything, anywhere, anytime.

7.title: Worlds Record
7.plot: When Angelo learns his arch nemesis Tracy is featured in the "Worlds' Book of World Records" he vows to get his name in the book too.

8.title: Mudman
8.plot: Angelo makes the mistake of showing Peter a monster movie and now Peter can't sleep, which means Angelo can't sleep until Peter can sleep.

9.title: Zonked Out
9.plot: Coach Zonka abruptly quits coaching the soccer team a week before the championship. So it's up to assistant coach Angelo to figure out why Zonka quit and get him back on the sidelines.

11.title: Double Agent
11.plot: For the upcoming Science Fair, Angelo and friends build a drone, which is promptly destroyed by Tracy. So Angelo talks a reluctant Lola into going "undercover" to spy on Tracy's plans to win the Fair.

12.title: Magic Show
12.plot: Amateur magician Angelo decides to up the ante after finding out from former professional magician Geezer that every famous magician has created their own signature trick.

13.title: Into the Wild
13.plot: When Mom won't let Angelo, Peter, and Dad go camping in the wild, the guys show her they have survival skills by spending the night outside in the backyard.

16.title: Road Trip!
16.plot: Angelo makes sure the two hour car ride to the Swamp Dragons playoff game is as fun as the game itself.

20.title: The Big Heist

28.title: Dumb Luck
28.plot: As dumb luck would have it, Angelo scores in the highest percentile on an IQ test! Einstein is rolling in his grave when they make Angelo "Consulting Principal" for a week.

33.title: The Longest 30 Seconds
33.plot: Angelo's convinces Slobber to get back to their "garage band" roots. They agree, decide to use his garage, and move in, getting them to move out is the hard part.

43.title: How Not To Be Angelo
43.plot: Tracy set a trap for Angelo, and she knows him so well that she's anticipated every single one of his strategies to get out of it! Angelo has to think like the other students to come up with a counter-plan.

47.title: Book of Tracy
47.plot: Tracy steals the book Angelo has been keeping filled with his strategies. Angelo must get it back before Tracy reads it.

imdb.plot outline: At 11 years old, Angelo is a little young to be a called wise-guy but he's certainly well on his way. From elaborate plans to comic strategies, Angelo sweet-talks and works his way around his various adversaries and problems. He's a genius with a knack for getting out of trouble. He's a stop-at-nothing kind of kid, undaunted by any thing put in his way. The bigger the challenge, the bigger the plan. Angelo without a plan? Unthinkable. Sure, he's got the usual obstacles - siblings, parents, and school rules. Who hasn't? He hasn't got any superpowers to rely on, just his wits. The main weapons in his arsenal are clever planning, irreverent attitude, a rebellious nature, optimism, and, most of all, charisma. Combine those traits with his two best friends, Sherwood, the king of logistics and Lola whose own enthusiasm can even eclipse Angelo's, and you've got a winning trio. With a knowing smile and an arched eyebrow, Angelo can give you the lowdown on how to get exactly what you want. If you know what's good for you, you better listen closely.
imdb.title: Angelo Rules

plot: _Angelo Rules_ (qv) follows 11-year-old Angelo, a sweet-talking genius with a knack for getting out of trouble.::gadiel philip

At 11 years old, Angelo is a little young to be a called wise-guy but he's certainly well on his way. From elaborate plans to comic strategies, Angelo sweet-talks and works his way around his various adversaries and problems. He's a genius with a knack for getting out of trouble. He's a stop-at-nothing kind of kid, undaunted by any thing put in his way. The bigger the challenge, the bigger the plan. Angelo without a plan? Unthinkable. Sure, he's got the usual obstacles - siblings, parents, and school rules. Who hasn't? He hasn't got any superpowers to rely on, just his wits. The main weapons in his arsenal are clever planning, irreverent attitude, a rebellious nature, optimism, and, most of all, charisma. Combine those traits with his two best friends, Sherwood, the king of logistics and Lola whose own enthusiasm can even eclipse Angelo's, and you've got a winning trio. With a knowing smile and an arched eyebrow, Angelo can give you the lowdown on how to get exactly what you want. If you know what's good for you, you better listen closely.
synopsis:
For a kid, life can be a daily battle. There are adults, siblings, teachers and rivals telling you what to do, what not to do, what to say, and blah blah blah...Well it's time for us kids to take control! I'm here to show you the way. Sure I have an annoying kid brother, a big sister who gets to do just about anything, and two parents who boss me around...But to me, they're all just my guinea pigs who unwittingly help me craft my theories.
I observe and then come up with elaborate strategies to wheedle, sweet-talk, con, and work around any adversary. Luckily, my friends Lola and Sherwood are here to help me!
